title: Nobel laureate Wole Soyinka; Saving the Florida grasshopper sparrow
description: Acclaimed Nigerian author and Nobel laureate Wole Soyinka talks about the relationship between the British Monarchy and his homeland of Nigeria, and the legacy of colonialism. And, the Florida grasshopper sparrow was on the brink of extinction but now numbers are rebounding in the wild. WMFE environmental reporter Amy Green reports.

itunes:author: NPR
